SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

javanews.database
Class SQLStatements

java.lang.Object
  javanews.database.SQLStatements

public class SQLStatements
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains all SQL statements used by an instance of DbInterface. There are no methods other than those returning a String value to be used as part of a Statement or PreparedStatement.

Those Strings to be used as part of a PreparedStatement can be identified by the presence of a ? within the String.

Version:
1.000
Author:
Alex Harris (email: Alexander.J.Harris(at)btinternet.com)
See Also:
PreparedStatement, Statement, DbInterface

Constructor Detail

SQLStatements

public SQLStatements()
The only constructor for the class. Used to initialise the logger before further class use.

Method Detail

updateDetails

public java.lang.String updateDetails()
Returns the SQL string used to update the details and description of a recognised link within the database. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameters passed as follows:
  1. The details of the link to be saved
  2. The description of the link to be saved
  3. The universally unique identifier of the link to be updated

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

removeAllNewLinks

public java.lang.String removeAllNewLinks()
Returns the SQL string used to remove all discovered links from the database during the application shutdown. The string must be used as part of a Statement.

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
Statement

getComments

public java.lang.String getComments()
Returns the SQL string used to retrieve the comments attached to a given message. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameters passed as follows:
  1. The ID of the message

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

public java.lang.String getDefinition()

  1. The ID of the message

The SQL string

  1. The ID of the message

Returns:

getNewLinkDetails

public java.lang.String getNewLinkDetails()
Returns the SQL string used to retrieve the details of a discovered link from the database. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameters passed as follows:
  1. The ID of the discovered link

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

addNewLink

public java.lang.String addNewLink()
Returns the SQL string used to add a newly discovered link to the database. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameters passed as follows:
  1. The ID of the link to be used for future reference
  2. The name of the COM Port being monitored
  3. The name of the PSE in question
  4. The name of the link on the named PSE

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

getMessageIDs

public java.lang.String getMessageIDs()
Returns the SQL string to be used to list the contents of the tblMessages table within the database.

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
Statement

getNewLinkID

public java.lang.String getNewLinkID()
Returns the SQL string used to obtain a link ID of a discovered link. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameters passed as follows:
  1. The name of the COM Port being monitored
  2. The name of the PSE in question
  3. The name of the link on the named PSE

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

removeNewLink

public java.lang.String removeNewLink()
Returns the SQL string used to remove a designated link from the new links table. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameters passed as follows:
  1. The ID of the link within the table

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

getLinkDetails

public java.lang.String getLinkDetails()
Returns the SQL string used to obtain link details. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameters passed as follows:
  1. Unique identifier of the PSE and link within tblCodexLinks

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

addMessage

public java.lang.String addMessage()
Returns the SQL string used to add a message to the database. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameters passed as follows:
  1. The ID of the message
  2. The ID of the recognised PSE node (this is mutually exclusive with the next field)
  3. The ID of the discovered PSE node (this is mutually exclusive with the previous field)
  4. The date of the alarm according to the local PSE's clock
  5. The ID of the message against the list of recognised messages
  6. The severity of the received message
  7. The full contents of the message

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

addComment

public java.lang.String addComment()
Returns the SQL string used to add a comment to the database. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameters passed as follows:
  1. The ID of the comment
  2. The ID of the parent message
  3. The name of the person adding the comment
  4. The contents of the comment

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

getCodexLinks

public java.lang.String getCodexLinks()
Returns the SQL string used to obtain the codex links. The string must be used as part of a Statement.

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
Statement

getCodexID

public java.lang.String getCodexID()
Returns the SQL string used to obtain a codex ID. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameters passed as follows:
  1. The name of the COM Port being monitored
  2. The name of the PSE in question
  3. The link name within the named PSE

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

getMessagesByDate

public java.lang.String getMessagesByDate()
Returns the SQL string used to obtain messages received between particular dates. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameters passed as follows:
  1. The starting date and time for the range
  2. The end date and time for the range
  3. The name of the COM Port being monitored

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

getMessagesByPSE

public java.lang.String getMessagesByPSE()
Returns the SQL string used to obtain messages received from all links on a named PSE. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameters passed as follows:
  1. The name of the COM Port being monitored
  2. The name of the PSE in question

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

getMessagesByPSEandLink

public java.lang.String getMessagesByPSEandLink()
Returns the SQL string used to obtain messages received from a named link on a named PSE. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameter passed as follows:
  1. The name of the COM Port being monitored
  2. The name of the PSE in question
  3. The link name within the named PSE

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

updateNewLinkID

public java.lang.String updateNewLinkID()
Returns the SQL string used to change a link id from discovered to recognised. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameter passed as follows:
  1. The ID of the recognised link to be used
  2. The ID of the discovered link to be changed

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement

storeRecognisedLink

public java.lang.String storeRecognisedLink()
Returns the SQL string used to store the details for a recognised link. The string must be used as part of a PreparedStatement and parameter passed as follows:
  1. The link's identifier
  2. The COM port identifier
  3. The PSE name
  4. The link ID or port name
  5. The details of the link
  6. The description of the link

Returns:
The SQL string
See Also:
PreparedStatement
